articles.title: Govt rolls out Rs 4,531-cr market access support for exporters
articles.summary: The government has launched a Rs 4,531 crore market access support scheme to aid exporters in participating in international fairs and exhibitions. This initiative, part of a larger export promotion mission, aims to help businesses navigate challenges like steep US tariffs.

articles.title: RBI flags high insurance commissions as risk to affordability, penetration
articles.summary: The RBI has joined the finance ministry and IRDAI in raising concerns over rising insurance distribution costs, cautioning that elevated commission payouts are being passed on to policyholders through higher premiums, potentially slowing progress toward universal insurance coverage.

articles.title: Tobacco stocks tank in early trade; Godfrey Phillips down 10%
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while ‘beedi' will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Additional excise duty on tobacco, health cess on pan masala to be effective February 1
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while biris will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Underwriting Auction for sale of Government Security for ₹32,000 crore on January 02, 2026
articles.summary: Policy update from RBI Press Releases

articles.title: Bharat Forge growth plan intact irrespective of India–US trade deal: Baba Kalyani
articles.summary: Baba Kalyani said the key challenge for exporters is the sharp 45–50% slowdown in the US market rather than tariffs, adding that Bharat Forge is adjusting to current volatility and does not see the disruption as a long-term issue.

articles.title: Israeli trade negotiators to visit India in January for FTA talks
articles.summary: Israeli trade negotiators will visit India in January for trade pact talks. This marks a pre-round for a Free Trade Agreement. Indian negotiators are expected to visit Russia after Budget 2026. This visit is for the second round of negotiations for the Russia-led Eurasian Economic Union trade pact. Bilateral trade between India and Israel was $3.62 billion in FY25.

articles.title: Execution tops sops as states race to attract data centres
articles.summary: Karnataka, Telangana, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, Haryana and West Bengal have announced policies and incentives to position themselves as preferred destinations. But operators say the competition has now shifted from policy to implementation. For them, power remains the most critical requirement-data centres require uninterrupted electricity, high-capacity substations and long-term regulatory certainty.

articles.title: Sanjay Malhotra asks RBI staff to persist in calibrating regulations, focus on customer centricity in new year
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra urged staff to enhance regulatory calibrations and supervision in the new year, emphasizing customer centricity and financial inclusion. He highlighted the need for improved analytical capabilities, technology adoption, and a commitment to core institutional values amidst a dynamic economic landscape.

articles.title: Director compliance relief: Corporate affairs ministry eases KYC norms, shifts from annual filing to 3-year cycle
articles.summary: Company directors in India now face a simplified annual KYC filing, shifting to a triennial requirement under the Companies Act, 2013. This move, effective March 31, 2026, eases compliance burdens. A new, comprehensive KYC form will also facilitate updates to personal details and DIN reactivation, benefiting all directors.

articles.title: GST compensation cess on tobacco to end on Feb 1, orders govt; new laws notified
articles.summary: The govt also issued orders that the Health Security se National Security Cess Act and the Central Excise (Amendment) Act, would come into effect from Feb 1

articles.title: India's exports may reach $950 billion in FY27 on West Asia trade pacts
articles.summary: India's export horizons are expanding rapidly, with projections hitting $840-850 billion in FY26 and climbing to $950 billion in FY27. The fostering of free trade agreements, particularly with nations in West Asia, alongside robust growth in sectors like services and electronics, are pivotal to this surge.

articles.title: One thing India’s economy needs so much in 2026
articles.summary: 2026 India Outlook: Despite a 50% tariff, India's exports to US have risen, driven by exporter adjustments and temporary coping strategies. However, this resilience is fragile, with high tariffs threatening long-term growth, jobs, and competitiveness. A win-win trade deal is crucial for India to secure market access and sustain its economic strategy.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime
articles.summary: In a series of notifications on New Year’s Day, the Finance Ministry announced the end of GST compensation cess, the increase in the excise duty on tobacco products, and the new GST rates on these items as well

articles.title: Unclaimed bank deposits hit  ₹62,314 crore, says RBI: Step-by-step guide to reclaim your money
articles.summary: As of 2024, unclaimed deposits in Indian banks total ₹62,314 crore, with public sector banks holding most. SBI leads with ₹16,968.41 crore. The government initiated a campaign to reclaim these funds, which have significantly increased since 2021.

articles.title: Zero-duty market access to Indian exports, pledge to invest $20 billion, and more: Highlights of India-New Zealand free trade agreement
articles.summary: India has offered tariff liberalisation in 70% lines covering 95% of New Zealand India Bilateral trade

articles.title: GST collection grows 6.1% in December 2025 as rate-cut impact shows
articles.summary: The GST rate cuts effected in September 2025 made hundreds of items cheaper but reduced the central government's monthly GST revenue at the same time.

articles.title: Government notifies first set of export promotion mission scheme
articles.summary: India has launched a Rs 4,531 crore Market Access Support intervention to aid MSMEs and first-time exporters in expanding global reach and overcoming trade finance hurdles. This initiative, part of a larger export promotion mission, aims to boost buyer connections and market presence through structured interventions and financial support for international participation.

articles.title: Cabinet greenlights two highway projects worth Rs 20,668 crore
articles.summary: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved two major highway projects. These include the Nashik-Solapur-Akkalkot Corridor and the widening of NH-326. The total cost for these infrastructure developments is Rs 20,668 crore. This initiative will enhance connectivity between key cities in Maharashtra and beyond. It aligns with the PM Gatishakti National Master Plan principles for integrated transport development.

articles.title: CM challenges KCR to discuss water projects in Assembly
articles.summary: Alleges lure of “commissions” responsible for PRLIS project cost rising from ₹32,000 crore to ₹84,000 crore; Mr. Revanth Reddy says government will inquire into the issue

articles.title: India’s chip ambition takes flight with customers signing up
articles.summary: India’s semiconductor push is moving beyond announcements and capital commitments, as global customers start to sign up for local manufacturing and assembly. While the momentum so far has been policy-led, customers coming on board shows that India is increasingly being viewed as a workable link in global supply chains, experts said.

articles.title: The Tencent-Flipkart test: Is New Delhi about to ease up on Chinese investment?
articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: A year of insurance reforms in India, yet more ground to cover
articles.summary: Over the past year, India has rewritten key rules governing insurance. Yet for policyholders, the real test lies not in regulation, but in how these changes play out when a claim is filed.

articles.title: Ensure Bengaluru does not become a gas chamber like Delhi, Khandre tells officials
articles.summary: Khandre says, ‘When I recently went to Delhi, it was difficult to breathe in the smog-filled atmosphere. The officials should be committed to protecting Bengaluru and strictly follow all the laws framed by the State and the Central governments for environmental protection.’

articles.title: Government to provide land at near zero cost to shipyards investing in shipbuilding and repair facilities in India
articles.summary: The government is revolutionizing the shipbuilding industry by offering land at near-zero cost to shipyards. This initiative aims to attract global investment, reduce operational costs and enhance India's position in the maritime sector, paving the way for sustainable growth in coastal states.

articles.title: Government to release new series of retail inflation, GDP data from February, IIP from May next year
articles.summary: The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation will hold a pre-release consultative workshop on the base revision of GDP, CPI, and IIP on December 23

articles.title: Union Budget 2026 should push R&D, tap demographic dividend: CareEdge’s Rajani Sinha
articles.summary: CareEdge Group’s Chief Economist Rajani Sinha suggests that the Union Budget 2026 should prioritise research and development, innovation, and better utilisation of India’s workforce. She also emphasised the need for structural reforms, including land policy improvements and measures to attract more foreign investment, to drive long-term economic growth.

articles.title: Nashik-Solapur-Akkalkot corridor, NH-326 widening get cabinet nod
articles.summary: The Union Cabinet has approved the construction of a 374-km, six-lane greenfield Nashik-Solapur-Akkalkot corridor in Maharashtra at a cost of ₹19,142 crore. This project, to be built in Build-Operate-Transfer mode, will enhance connectivity to key cities and integrate with the PM Gatishakti National Master Plan. Additionally, NH-326 in Odisha will be widened and strengthened for ₹1,526.21 crore.

articles.title: India, Israel teams may meet next month on proposed trade pact: Official
articles.summary: India and Israel teams will meet next month to discuss a proposed Free Trade Agreement. This pact aims to boost bilateral trade and investments between the two nations. Negotiations for the agreement formally began in November. The upcoming meeting will focus on structuring the FTA. Trade representatives from Israel are expected to attend these crucial talks.

articles.title: India boards 'reform express' in 2025, puts people before paperwork
articles.summary: Year ender 2025: This year, India embarked on sweeping economic reforms that transformed its financial landscape. The Goods and Services Tax was streamlined with revised rates, and the income tax framework saw a comprehensive overhaul. Labour laws were updated to meet modern demands, while sectors like nuclear energy welcomed private investment for the first time.

articles.title: 8th Pay Commission: When will central govt employees get their arrears? How much money will they receive?
articles.summary: While the provisions of the 8th Pay Commission will be effective from 1 January, 2026, the implementation is expected to be delayed. This is why government employees and pensioners will receive arrears.

articles.title: Leading the AI infrastructure push: A look back at how 2025 played out for Sam Altman and OpenAI
articles.summary: By 2025, OpenAI under Sam Altman had shifted AI from novelty to critical infrastructure, with ChatGPT driving growth and vast spending on compute. Altman pushed autonomous agents, massive data centres and long-term bets despite losses. He acknowledged bubbles, fierce competition and regulation risks, but argued AI’s economic impact would be transformational.

articles.title: UPI rebounds from November dip, ends December with new high of 21.6 billion transactions
articles.summary: UPI hit record transaction volumes and value in December, rebounding after a softer November, driven by festive and year-end spending. Other digital payment modes such as IMPS and FASTag also saw growth, while AePS declined sequentially. Even as usage rises, NPCI is reviewing certain features to address consumer safety concerns.

articles.title: India’s GST collections rise 6% to ₹1.75 lakh crore in December
articles.summary: India’s goods and services tax (GST) collections reached ₹1.75 lakh crore ($19.45 billion) in December, up 6.1% from the same month last year, the government said on Thursday.

articles.title: Amid growing strains, Centre bets on discipline to rein in the fisc
articles.summary: Record RBI dividends and strong consumption provide a cushion but rising subsidies and tight deficit math point to a narrower fiscal path ahead.

articles.title: Your 2026 financial calendar: Key dates, deadlines and decisions that will shape your finances
articles.summary: Throughout the year, there are key financial actions and deadlines that can make a real difference to your tax savings, compliance, investments, travel plans and overall money health

articles.title: CITU conference condemns VB-G RAM G, SHANTI Acts, Labour Codes
articles.summary: VB-G RAM G Act has overturned statutory rights, alongwith imposing financial and administrative burden on the State governments, undermining the federal structure of the Constitution: CITU general secretary

articles.title: India, Oman trade pact likely to be operationalised within three months: Goyal
articles.summary: Under the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, Oman has offered zero-duty access on over 98 of its tariff lines or product categories, covering 99.38% of India's exports to the Gulf country

articles.title: From Trainee to Employer: Ajit Raj Scales Eye Care in Siddharthnagar
articles.summary: Siddharthnagar resident Ajit Raj leveraged the Mukhyamantri Yuva Udyami Yojana to equip his optical practice and create local jobs.

articles.title: Pokimane offends New York’s straight men after her comments about “good-looking gay men” go viral
articles.summary: Twitch star Pokimane has sparked a huge online discussion after sharing her observations about men in New York. She noted a pattern of finding attractive men to be gay, often leading to friendships. Separately, Pokimane addressed misconceptions about her wealth, revealing her immigrant background and focus on saving for family.

articles.title: Vande Bharat Sleeper Train Launch Soon On This Route! Indian Railways’ New Train Better Than Rajdhani - Check Photos, Ticket Price & Top 10 Facts
articles.summary: Update from Times of India - Business

articles.title: Auto sales surge: Passenger vehicle wholesales hit record 45.5 lakh units in 2025; GST 2.0, SUVs drive turnaround
articles.summary: Indian passenger vehicle sales reached a record 45.5 lakh units in 2025. This growth of nearly 6 percent was boosted by policy tailwinds in the second half. Several manufacturers like Maruti Suzuki, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Tata Motors achieved their highest annual sales.

articles.title: Healthcare shock for Americans! Medical insurance subsidies expired; millions stuck with hiked premiums
articles.summary: Millions of Americans will now face significantly higher healthcare costs as enhanced Affordable Care Act tax credits expired January 1, 2026. Over 20 million individuals are impacted, with average premiums more than doubling. Despite bipartisan efforts, a legislative solution remains elusive, leaving many to consider dropping coverage or absorbing increased expenses.

articles.title: Investors pile into India’s short bonds on RBI rate outlook
articles.summary: Bond carry trades, which seek to profit from the gap between low RBI repo rate and high government bond yields, are growing ever more popular in India.

articles.title: AI a 'big opportunity', essential to ensure its benefits reach all: President Droupadi Murmu
articles.summary: President Droupadi Murmu said artificial intelligence offers India a major opportunity for inclusive growth if its benefits reach all sections of society. She highlighted AI’s role in boosting GDP, jobs and productivity, and stressed skilling in data and AI. The government, she said, is promoting responsible AI adoption through education and national missions.

articles.title: Brookfield to start cloud business amid AI frenzy: The Information
articles.summary: Brookfield plans to launch its own cloud business, leasing chips in data centres directly to AI developers. It will be backed by a new $10 billion AI fund and Radiant, developing data centres in France, Qatar and Sweden. The strategy tightens Brookfield’s AI supply chain control and adds pressure on cloud giants.

articles.title: Rupee to grapple incessant volatility in 2026; US trade pact may not be silver bullet
articles.summary: The Indian rupee faces ongoing depreciation due to global trade issues and foreign fund withdrawals. A trade agreement with the United States is anticipated to stabilize the currency. Experts predict further short-term declines before a potential appreciation later in the fiscal year. Macroeconomic fundamentals offer long-term support.

articles.title: India’s fiscal fault lines between Centre and states return to the spotlight
articles.summary: Recent changes to India's rural job guarantee scheme have brought back into the spotlight long-running disputes between the Union government and states on how financial resources should be shared.

articles.title: China hails India overtaking Japan as world’s 4th largest economy, says ‘true strength comes from…’
articles.summary: The Central government announced on Tuesday, December 30, that India has surpassed Japan to become the world's fourth-largest economy with a size of USD 4.18 trillion

articles.title: Govt keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for the March quarter
articles.summary: The government has kept interest rates for popular small savings schemes such as the Public Provident Fund (PPF) and the National Savings Certificate (NSC) unchanged for the eighth consecutive quarter.

articles.title: ₹6,000 crore to BJP — 12 times what Congress got: Top political donors in FY25 revealed!
articles.summary: In the 2024-25, the BJP bagged most of the political donations, securing over ₹6,000 crore compared to Congress's mere ₹522 crore. This funding surge follows the Supreme Court's scrapping of the Electoral Bond scheme, shifting the landscape of political financing in India.

articles.title: Auto sector outlook 2026: Demand seen sustaining, premiumisation key theme; GST cuts, pay commission to drive growth
articles.summary: After a slow start in 2025, policy support and tax rationalisation helped revive auto demand, particularly in entry-level and commercial vehicles. As the industry heads into 2026, premiumisation, budget-led capex spending and potential pay commission benefits are expected to shape growth, even as automakers grapple with currency depreciation and rising input costs.

articles.title: Audit push: NFRA releases second audit practice toolkit; focuses on revenue risk assessment
articles.summary: The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has launched its second Audit Practice Toolkit, focusing on revenue risk assessment for small and medium audit practitioners. This initiative aims to enhance audit quality by providing a practical guide for identifying and assessing material misstatements in revenue.

articles.summary: Update from Indian Express - Business

articles.title: MCA relaxes KYC norms for directors, replaces annual filing with 3-yr cycle
articles.summary: This amendment is aimed at providing significant ease of compliance to directors in all companies. All directors who have completed their KYC requirements to date are covered under the new provisions, and accordingly, their next KYC filing would be due by June 30, 2028

articles.title: GST, cess levy together to help detect evasion in pan masala sector: Sources
articles.summary: Finance Ministry introduces health and national security cess on pan masala manufacturing with 40 percent GST, creating a dual tax system to curb evasion and protect revenue from February 1.

articles.title: Tobacco industry body flags risks of steep excise duty hike, urges policy review
articles.summary: The Tobacco Institute of India warns that the sharp excise duty hike could harm farmers, MSMEs, and boost illicit trade, urging the government to reconsider its decision.

articles.title: Centre pre-publishes draft rules on four labour codes to seek stakeholders' feedback
articles.summary: The Ministry of Labour and Employment pre-published draft rules for four labour codes, aiming full implementation by April 1, 2026, to boost worker protection and simplify compliance nationwide.

articles.title: India and Pakistan exchange lists of civil prisoners and fishermen under 2008 Consular Pact
articles.summary: Policy update from Business Today - India

articles.title: India set to introduce overnight train service on Guwahati–Kolkata route after safety clearance
articles.summary: Policy update from Business Today - India

articles.title: 'They don’t know what a Collector actually does': Ex-Finance Secretary Subhash Garg on IAS expectations vs reality
articles.summary: Policy update from Business Today - India

articles.title: RBI to conduct ₹50,000 crore OMO purchase on January 5 to inject liquidity
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will purchase ₹50,000 crore in government securities on January 5 through an OMO auction, the second tranche in a ₹2 lakh crore liquidity plan.

articles.title: Pension reform: PFRDA allows banks to set up pension funds for NPS; aims to boost competition
articles.summary: Banks can now independently manage the National Pension System (NPS) as the PFRDA approves a new framework to boost competition and protect subscribers. This move, alongside revised investment fee structures and new NPS Trust board appointments, aims to create a more robust and competitive pension ecosystem for improved retirement security.

articles.title: India steps into 2026 with a brand new global playbook
articles.summary: India is shifting to a pragmatic, interest-based foreign policy for 2026, moving away from rigid alliances. This new global playbook prioritizes economic resilience through diversified trade, energy security via Russian oil purchases, and cautious engagement with China. The strategy aims for flexibility and autonomy, balancing partnerships with national interests in a multipolar world.

articles.title: India imposes provisional anti-dumping duty on low ash metallurgical coke imports
articles.summary: India has imposed a provisional anti-dumping duty of $60.87-$130.66 per tonne on low ash metallurgical coke imports for six months. This measure affects imports from Australia, China, Colombia, Indonesia, Japan, and Russia, potentially raising steelmaking costs as the country aims to boost steel production.

articles.title: Govt keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for March quarter
articles.summary: Government has maintained interest rates for twelve small savings schemes, including PPF and Sukanya Samriddhi, for the March quarter. This marks the eighth consecutive quarter without changes, despite the central bank's repo rate reductions. These collections aid in financing the government's fiscal deficit.

articles.title: Creditors realised Rs 4 lakh crore under IBC till September: RBI report
articles.summary: Creditors have recovered Rs 4 lakh crore through the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code by September 30, 2025. Over 78 percent of corporate insolvency resolution processes have concluded. The code has successfully rescued 3,865 corporate debtors since its inception. This initiative aims to revive struggling businesses. The report highlights significant recovery rates for creditors.

articles.title: Big Tech’s AI shopping spree in 2025: Who bought what
articles.summary: This year's AI sector saw a surge in high-profile acquisitions, with companies prioritising talent acquisition through strategic moves like Google's Wiz acquisition and Meta's investment in Scale AI. OpenAI also made significant moves, acquiring io for $6.5 billion and Statsig for $1.1 billion, signaling a push into consumer hardware and application development.

articles.title: India extends provisional anti-dumping duty on low-ash metallurgical coke imports from six countries till 30 June
articles.summary: The move came after an investigation found that imports dumped from Australia, China, Colombia, Indonesia, Japan and Russia were causing material injury to the domestic industry.

articles.title: Cabinet clears  ₹20,688 crore highway projects in Maharashtra, Odisha
articles.summary: The approved road projects include the country's largest ever highway project under the build-operate-transfer model, a greenfield 374-km Nashik-Solapur-Akkalkot corridor in Maharashtra

articles.title: India's fiscal deficit hits  ₹9.76 trillion, nearly two-thirds of target
articles.summary: Better-than-expected non-tax revenue collection of ₹5.16 trillion, or 88.6% of the full-year budget estimate, cushioned the central government's finances.

articles.title: RBI cautions against risks to economy even as fundamentals remain strong
articles.summary: The RBI cautioned against a sudden and sharp correction in the US equity market. Such a situation, it said, could cause a correction in domestic equities, affect investor confidence and wealth,

articles.title: India imposes three-year safeguard duty on some steel products to curb cheap imports
articles.summary: The measure, which was published on the official government gazette, excludes imports from certain developing countries, though China, Vietnam, and Nepal will be subject to the levy. It also will not apply to specialty steel products such as stainless steel.

articles.title: India imposes three-year tariff on some steel products after ‘sudden, sharp’ increase in imports
articles.summary: China, Vietnam, and Nepal will be subject to the levy; known as a safeguard duty, it be imposed at 12% in the ​first year followed by 11.5% in ⁠the second year and then 11% in the third year

articles.title: India is now fourth largest economy, says govt.
articles.summary: The government says that with the GDP valued at $4.18 trillion, “India has surpassed Japan to become the world’s fourth largest economy”, it says that the country is “poised to displace Germany from the third rank” with a projected GDP of $7.3 trillion by 2030

articles.title: Who is VV Rajesh? Meet the lawyer who become BJP’s first mayor of Thiruvananthapuram
articles.summary: VV Rajesh, a seasoned politician and lawyer,  has been elected as BJP's first-ever mayoral for Thiruvananthapuram, marking a historic shift in local governance after 45 years of Left rule. Discover how his political journey shaped this monumental moment for the saffron party.

articles.title: Chicago Council Passes 2026 Budget to Close $1.2 Billion Gap
articles.summary: Chicago’s City Council passed a roughly $16 billion budget for 2026 — less than two weeks before the deadline — without certainty about whether Mayor Brandon Johnson will sign or veto the plan.

articles.title: BJP again attacks Rahul alleging Soros link, claims he met ‘enemies of India’ in Germany
articles.summary: Last year too, the BJP had alleged that top Congress leaders had links with George Soros-funded organisations that were involved in ‘anti-India’ activities

articles.title: Why manufacturing has lagged in India
articles.summary: India’s manufacturing sector underperforms compared to China and South Korea, partly due to public sector wages that raise costs and reduce competitiveness; despite growth in private industries like software and services, India sees limited technological upgrading, uneven wage growth, and increasing inequality

articles.title: Business events that shaped India in 2025
articles.summary: From Trump’s trade war to RBI repo rate cuts and major corporate entries, 2025 delivered several notable developments. Though not all were transformational, a few deserve closer attention.

articles.title: What is the Pink Saheli Card? Free travel for women in Delhi, how to apply & more details

Auto shipments also saw record performance, contributing to the nation's robust economic growth despite challenging global trade conditions.

A sharp correction in US equities could spill over to domestic markets and tighten financial conditions, it warned.

The government aims to narrow the fiscal gap to 4.4% of GDP in this financial year from 4.8% a year earlier.

articles.summary: Hero MotoCorp sales surged 40 percent in December to 4.56 lakh units, beating CNBC-TV18 estimates, with strong growth in both domestic and export markets. Shares closed at ₹5,837.00, up 1.14 percent.

articles.title: Lowest steel prices in five years in India in 2025: T V Narendran
articles.summary: Steel prices in India touched their lowest level in the past five years during 2025, despite strong domestic demand and supply, Tata Steel CEO and Managing Director T V Narendran said on Thursday.

articles.title: Punjab & Sind Bank Q3 Update: Total business up 12% to ₹2.49 lakh crore
articles.summary: Total deposits rose to ₹1,39,203 crore at the end of December 2025, up 2.58% from the previous quarter and 9.27% higher than a year earlier. CASA deposits increased to ₹43,182 crore, registering a 4.99% sequential growth and an 8.77% rise on a year-on-year basis.

articles.title: India needs stronger infrastructure, lower logistics costs to sustain 8-9% growth: Baba Kalyani
articles.summary: Bharat Forge Chairman Baba Kalyani says India must now focus on improving urban infrastructure and cutting logistics costs to convert the current surge in private investment into long-term, high-quality economic growth.

articles.title: India’s household borrowing at 41.3% of GDP manageable, but reckless lending a risk, say experts
articles.summary: India’s rising reliance on consumption-led borrowing is reshaping household balance sheets, even as economists and bankers stress that the real risk lies not in the debt level itself but in weak underwriting and unchecked growth in unsecured loans.

articles.title: GST collections rise in December 2025, gross revenue up 6.1% to ₹1,74,550 crore
articles.summary: Gross GST revenue reached ₹1,74,550 crore in December 2025, up 6.1 percent from December 2024, with notable growth in import and customs revenue, according to December 31, 2025 data.

articles.title: AI-led productivity, not trade wars, to drive the next global growth phase: William Lee
articles.summary: William Lee, Chief Economist and Managing Director at Global Economic Advisors, said India must provide clearer signals to fully capitalise on the emerging global economic shift. This includes unequivocally welcoming foreign investment, opening markets further, and dismantling long-standing political barriers.

articles.title: India's April-November fiscal deficit at 62.3% of 2025/26 target
articles.summary: India’s fiscal deficit hit 9.8 trillion rupees in April-November, 62.3% of the yearly estimate, with net tax receipts at 13.9 trillion rupees and capital expenditure at 6.6 trillion rupees.

articles.title: Aurobindo Pharma subsidiary acquires Khandelwal Laboratories’ non-oncology prescription business for ₹325 cr
articles.summary: Auro Pharma Ltd acquires Khandelwal Laboratories' non-oncology prescription business, adding 23 brands and 470 staff, boosting its pain management and anti-infective portfolio in India. Shares of Aurobindo Pharma Ltd ended higher on Thursday, January 1, by 1.18% at ₹1,197.00 on the NSE.

articles.title: MOIL revises manganese ore prices for January 2026, ferro grades up 3%
articles.summary: According to the company, all Ferro grades of manganese ore with Manganese content of Mn-44% and above have been increased by 3% over prices prevailing since December 1, 2025. Shares of MOIL Ltd ended at ₹368.95, up by ₹0.40, or 0.11%, on the BSE.

articles.title: ED freezes fresh Rs 192-cr deposits of WinZO in money laundering case
articles.summary: The raid at the office premises of the auditor was conducted on December 30.

articles.title: Akzo Nobel India's FY19 GST demand slashed from ₹177 crore to ₹42 lakh
articles.summary: The matter relates to a show-cause notice issued by the Karnataka GST Department on June 27, 2025, which had proposed a total demand of ₹176.65 crore. Shares of Akzo Nobel India Ltd ended at ₹3,180.00, down by ₹2.70, or 0.085%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Indian Bank reports 13.4% growth in Q3 FY26 total business
articles.summary: Indian Bank reported 13.4% business growth in Q3 FY26, with advances at ₹6.40 lakh crore and deposits at ₹7.90 lakh crore. Shares of Indian Bank ended marginally lower on Thursday, January 1, by 0.45% at ₹833.50 on the NSE.

articles.title: M&M sees GST-led demand and EV launches driving growth in 2026
articles.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra expects GST-led demand, EV launches and product refreshes to support growth in 2026. The company plans to ramp up EV capacity, sees a replacement cycle in commercial vehicles, and is reviewing pricing amid higher raw material costs, according to automotive division CEO Nalinikanth Gollagunta.

articles.title: Bharat Electronics secures ₹569 crore in additional orders since Dec 29 disclosure
articles.summary: Major orders received during the period comprise communication equipment, medical electronics, instant fire detection and suppression systems, along with upgrades, spares and related services. Shares of Bharat Electronics Ltd ended at ₹397.85, down by ₹0.44, or 1.75%, on the BSE.

articles.title: HDFC Tech Innovators 2025 spotlights 12 startups shaping India’s future
articles.summary: The 4th edition of HDFC Tech Innovators concluded with the top 10 innovators and 2 emerging women founders being felicitated at the Grand Finale in Mumbai on December 3, 2025.

articles.title: What growing SMBs learned from Lenovo’s AI PC webinar
articles.summary: The webinar explored how AI-powered PCs are helping SMBs cut downtime, boost productivity, and unlock enterprise-grade capabilities without enterprise-level complexity.

articles.title: Nexus Power: Reinventing Battery Tech with Bio-Organic, Lithium-Free Innovation
articles.summary: Nexus Power is building biodegradable batteries from crop waste to power EVs, reduce pollution, and replace lithium-based cells.

articles.title: Maharajganj Youth Builds a Sustainable Nursery Business from Family Land in Nichlaul
articles.summary: A young founder from Bedwali Gram Sabha outlines how his small nursery raises fruit and forest saplings for farmers and local institutions.

articles.title: Blinkit CFO Vipin Kapooria resigns
articles.summary: Kapooria's resignation comes at a time when competition in quick commerce space has intensified, and a few days after rival Zepto filed preliminary papers to raise Rs 11,000 crore through an IPO.

articles.title: Russia stays India’s top crude oil supplier even as Dec volumes fall after sanctions: Kpler
articles.summary: India’s Russian crude imports fell to a three-year low in December due to sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil, but Russia remained India’s top supplier via intermediaries and alternative trading channels.
